com.mansoor.uncommon.configuration.Convertors
Interface ConverterRegistry

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultConverterRegistry
public interface ConverterRegistry

ConverterRegistry acts as a converter repository and defines method to add, retrieve and clear Converter from the registry. ConverterRegistry is responsible for providing appropriate Converter for a given type.

Since:
0.1
Author:
Muhammad Ashraf

Method Summary
<A> void
addConverter(Class<A> type, Converter<A> converter)
          Adds a converter to the registry keyed on a Class type.
 void clear()
          Clears all the Converter from the registry
<A> Converter<A>

          Returns a converter for the given type.
 

Method Detail

addConverter

<A> void addConverter(Class<A> type,
                      Converter<A> converter)
Adds a converter to the registry keyed on a Class type. This converter will be used to transform all instance of the given class type.

For example once a Float converter is added to the Registry, it will be invoke for all the Float value being set and retrieved through a Configuration 

   addConverter(Float.class, new FloatConverter());
   configuration.get(Foat.class, "floatValue");

Parameters:
type - Class for which this converter is configured
converter - Converter that is being added

getConverter

<A> Converter<A> getConverter(Class<A> type)
Returns a converter for the given type.

Parameters:
type - Class for which this converter is configured
Returns:
Converter
Throws:
ConverterNotFoundException - if no converter are found for this class

clear

void clear()
Clears all the Converter from the registry
